DBManager

Class DBObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • DBManager.DBObject

  • public class DBObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Chris Foxley-Evans This class is designed to represent a DB thus it holds a reference to a ConnectionManager this class also holds methods that are used to collect a DB meta data as well as a static method to perform the set up of the "schemastore" DB

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ConnectionManager connectionManager
      The ConnectionManager for this DBObject
      java.lang.String dbName
      The name of the DB that is being connected to
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> DBNames
      ArrayList to hold all of the database names on the server
      java.sql.DatabaseMetaData metaData
      The meta data for this DBObject
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tableNames
      ArrayList to store the names of the tables in this db

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBObject()
      Constructor to connect to the server directly
      DBObject(java.lang.String dbName)
      Constructor to connect to a specific DB on the server

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Static method that can be called to create the "schemastore" DB

      Method that take an sql string and runs it on the server

      Method to get the cols for each table in the db
